Header: Five held for allegedly raping girl
Summary: Suspects were under the influence of alcohol, reports the police
Detail:
Police registered a case against five young men for allegedly raping a girl in the limits of RA Bazaar police station on Thursday.
According to the police, the men were under the influence of alcohol. A case has been registered on the complaint of the victim girl.
The girl *M* informed the police that she received a phone call from her friend Fayaz, who asked her to go for a walk with him and she agreed.
After a while, Fayaz came with her cousin Rizwan to pick her up in a car near Sadiqabad police station. “They brought me to a bungalow at 22 Harley Street where they raped me.” The police registered a case and started the investigation.
Published in The Express Tribune, March 8th, 2024.

Summary: Competition aims to foster creativity among youth
Detail:
The Rawalpindi Arts Council hosted divisional-level competitions for the inaugural Punjab Painting Competition 2024 on Thursday, where emerging artists showcased their talents. Winners from district-level contests in Attock, Jhelum, Chakwal, Murree, and Rawalpindi participated in the event.
Rawalpindi Assistant Commissioner Coordination Shabana Nazir presided over the prize distribution ceremony as the chief guest. 
In her address to the participants, Nazir emphasised the significance of writers and painters as unique expressions of nature.
“Writers convey their thoughts through words, expressing with blood and emotions, while painters use colours to reflect nature, emotions, and societal realities.” Nazir congratulated the successful children and highlighted the role of painters in bringing people closer to nature.
Deputy Director Muhammad Shakoor underscored the innate human passion for creation, leading to various artistic expressions. He praised Pakistani painters for their confidence, conviction, and awareness in their work, noting how young artists transfer the themes of their surroundings onto canvases.
The painting competition aimed to cultivate a climate of creative growth among the youth, providing a platform for artists to showcase their talents.
Judges Ahmed Habib, Saima Amir, and Zarar Haider Babri evaluated the participants. Sara Hafeez, Abdul Hadi, and Aymen Azmat Butt secured the first, second, and third positions, respectively, in the Rawalpindi division competitions. The chief guest distributed cheques and appreciation certificates to the winners. The provincial-level competition is scheduled to take place at the Open Air Theater in Lahore on March 8.
Published in The Express Tribune, March 8th, 2024.

Summary: Disturbing footage goes viral on internet; DPO orders probe
Detail:
Weeks after several incidents of police violence in Rawalpindi, a similar case has surfaced in Haripur where a traffic warden has been accused of brutally torturing a citizen over a minor dispute.
The violent act went viral on social media, prompting authorities to take action.
According to local sources, the man had to be taken to a hospital for medical attention following the incident.
Following the circulation of the disturbing footage on social media, Haripur DPO Muhammad Umar Khan took action by suspending traffic warden Raja Azhar. A committee comprising DSP City and DSP Traffic was established to conduct a thorough investigation into the matter.
Expressing zero tolerance for violence and misconduct towards citizens, Haripur DPO issued a stern warning to all police officers and personnel. He emphasised the importance of upholding integrity within the police department and assured that those found guilty of such misconduct would face serious disciplinary measures.
Local drivers revealed that the accused, Raja Azhar, stationed near Haripur Rajput Bakery, had a history of aggressive behaviour and had been deployed in Haripur for an extended period. They recounted previous incidents of similar nature and expressed frustration over the lack of decisive action by the authorities. Meanwhile, the victim demanded intervention from higher-ranking officers, including the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa IG and Hazara DIG, urging for the dismissal of the responsible official.
Meanwhile, a Wapda lineman Tuesday lost his life when he slipped from an electricity pole while performing maintenance work in Khalabat, Haripur.
Published in The Express Tribune, March 8th, 2024.

Header: AMTI BoG lock horns over chairperson’s resignation
Summary: Rival group claims current head lacks mandate to run affairs
Detail:
The Ayub Medical Teaching Institution (AMTI)’s Board of Governors (BoG) are at loggerheads over a dispute rising from the acceptance of its chairman Mushtaq Jadoon’s resignation and the reinstatement of two employees who were terminated a few years back.
While requesting anonymity, a senior manager of AMTI told The Express Tribune that the BoG has been divided into two groups, one of which is led by outgoing chairman, Mushtaq Jadoon, while the other group is represented by senior lawyers Asad Khan Jadoon, Fawad Saleh and Syed Jafar shah.
It has been learnt that the dispute arose after the delay of notification by the KP government over the acceptance of BoG chariman’s resignation. During this period, a controversial letter was issued by the section officer of health about the resignation of Mushtaq Jadoon. The chairman had tendered his resignation from his office on February 9, 2024, just after the 94th BoG meeting.
It was further understood that Mushtaq Jadoon, Dr Aftab Rabani and Ayaz Khan seem to be on one page as they argue that the chairman can continue to work till a notification of the acceptance of resignation has been given.
Whereas Asad Khan, Fawad Saleh and Syed Jafar Shah have a different stance. 
They claim that after resignation from his slot, the chairman has no authority to make any decisions alongside the BoG. They further argue that his resignation had already been accepted by the caretaker chief minister.
It was also learnt that another member, Javed Turk has been observed to be moving as a rolling stone.
Published in The Express Tribune, March 8th, 2024.

Header: Pre-Ramazan sales attract customers of all ages
Summary: Pre-Ramazan sales attract customers of all ages
Detail:
As the month of Holy Ramazan is just a few days away, Pakistani brands offer a better shopping experience by providing customers with stylish and trendy clothes and giving them the best discount offers in pre-Ramazan sales which make shopping more fun and exciting.
The most awaited pre-Ramazan sales of up to 50% are the main attraction for citizens, where customers are witnessing a new collection of renowned fashion designers and new collections with the latest fashion trends, according to a report aired by private news channels.
High in quality fashion multi brands are seeing offering great discount offers, said a women citizen, adding, we are enjoying up to 50% off on entire clothing collections.
People have become more fashion-forward because of great fashion exposure, not just in Pakistan but all around the world, said a youngster.
Fashion brand stores have rapidly geared themselves up to appease their fashion desires by putting up a fantastic, astonishing and attractive sale, said another female customer.
The new trends are there and you have a choice to select from a wide range of collection.
Published in The Express Tribune, March 8th, 2024.
